intro: Dendrostellera griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Dendrostellera griffithii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
